https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Use the `say` block to make me say whatever you like!
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Hello, world! I'm a sprite. Use the `say` block to make me say whatever you like!_

-   Drag a `make new sprite` block into the workspace and connect it under `when run`.
-   Connect a `say` block _under_ a `make new sprite` block.
-   Make sure to select the same _costume_ in each block of code.
-   Press _"Run"_ when you are finished.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.bubble_choice_description: Make the sprite begin a new behavior after some time has passed.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Give each sprite a different location.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Give each sprite a different location._

-   Use the pin on the location block to move sprites to different locations.
-   Press _"Run"_ when you are finished.

authored_hints.location_pin_hint:
To change a sprite's location, click the pin on the location block, then click where you want it to go.

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Make each of your two sprites say something.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let's chat! Make your two sprites each say something._

-   Add code to make each sprite say something.
-   Press _"Run"_ when you are finished.

authored_hints.storyboard_costume:
Make sure the costumes match for each sprite.
[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_What's different here? Can you make these sprites talk?_

-   Read the code. What do you notice?
-   Click the _"Run"_ button.
-   Click or tap the sprites.

authored_hints.hw_no_changes: You don't need to change any of the code in this level.

callouts.hw_Run: Click here to run the code.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Use the `when clicked` event to make a sprite say something.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let’s make a sprite say something when you click on it!_

-   Connect a `say` block under a `when clicked` block.
-   Select the same costume in each block of code.
-   Press the _"Run"_ button.
-   Click or tap the sprite to have it say something.

_Extra Challenge:_ Make both sprites say something when they are clicked!

authored_hints.hello_world_click:
Connect a `say` block under a `when click` event block:

[blockly block][0]

callouts.hello_world_click_hint: Add this event block to your workspace.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:

_You may have already noticed these blocks:_ 
[blockly block][0]

[blockly block][1]

-   Place another `set background` block under an event to change the scene by clicking a sprite.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.bubble_choice_description: Learn to change the appearance of sprites.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Let's learn to change the appearance of sprites.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let's learn to change the appearance of sprites._

-   Use the new `change costume` block to change the costume of a sprite when it is clicked.
-   Remember that an `event` will cause something to happen when a user interacts with your sprites.

_Extra Challenge:_ Change a sprite’s costume more than once, or change the costumes of multiple sprites.

authored_hints.hello_world_costumes:
Try connecting a `change costume` block under a `when clicked` event block.

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.bubble_choice_description: Learn to change the size of sprites.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Let's learn to change the size of sprites.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let's learn to change the size of sprites._

-   Use the new blocks in the toolbox to change the size of a sprite. 
-   Make sure to choose a size other than 100.

_Challenge:_ Use **events** to change the size of the sprites when they are clicked.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Let's learn to animate sprites using behaviors.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let's learn to animate sprites using behaviors. Behaviors are actions that happen over and over while the program runs._

-   Use the new blocks at the bottom of the toolbox to animate one of the sprites.

_Challenge:_ Use **events** to make a sprite begin a behavior when it is clicked.

authored_hints.storyboard_behavior_example:
_Note:_ To give a sprite a behavior, you need to use a `sprite begins` block with one of the green behavior blocks, such as `spinning right`.

[blockly block][0]

callouts.hello_world_behavior_blocks: Use this block with one of the behaviors below.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: Let's learn how to play sounds.
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_Let's learn how to play sounds._

-   Use the new block in the the toolbox to play a sound.

_Challenge:_ Use **events** to play a sound when a sprite is clicked.

https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.short_instructions: It's time to create whatever you want!
https://studio.code.org/s/hello-world-em.long_instructions:
_It's time to start create whatever you want! When you are done, share your project and say "Hello!" to the people in your world!_
- Add more sprite _costumes_ to your project by clicking the _costumes_ tab. - Add _code_ to the workspace to make sprites appear. - Try adding more features to your project to make it even better. - Press the _Share_ button above to send your project to some friends! For some extra fun, check out the brand new `create effect` block in the **Sprites** category! [blockly block][0]

callouts.costumes_tab: Click here to add costumes to your project.
